text: Surely, reality is what we think it is; reality isrevealedto us by our experiences. To oneextentor another, this view ofrealityis one many of us hold, if only implicitlyI certainly find myself thinking this way in day-to-day life; it’s easy to be seduced by the face nature reveals directly to our senses. Yet, in the decades since first encountering Camus’ text. I’ve learned that modern science tells a very different story.
